docs.title: How to host MkDocs Project using GitHub Pages
docs.text: This step-by-step guide will walk you through creating a documentation site with MkDocs and hosting it using GitHub Pages.

docs.title: Prerequisites:
docs.text:
• Basic knowledge of Git and GitHub
  • Python 3.7 or above installed
  • Git installed
  • A GitHub account

docs.title: Step 1: Create a New MkDocs Project
docs.text:
1. Install MkDocs: 

    pip install mkdocs

  2. Create a new project: 

    mkdocs new my-docs
cd my-docs

  3. Preview your site locally 

    mkdocs serve
    Follow the link - http://127.0.0.1:8000 in your browser & you'll see the default homepage being displayed :

docs.title: Step 2: Initialise Git Repository
docs.text:
1. Initialise a Git repo and commit files 

    git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial MkDocs site"

  2. Create a new repository on GitHub (e.g., my-docs-site)

  3. Link the remote and push: 
    git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/my-docs-site.git
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main

docs.title: Step 3: Configure mkdocs.yml
docs.text:
1. Add or update the following lines in mkdocs.yml 
    site_name: My Docs
theme:
  name: material
  2. Install Material theme (if used): 
    pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: Step 4: Build the Site
docs.text:
Generate the static files using: 

mkdocs build
This creates a site/ directory containing the final HTML that looks like this:

docs.title: Step 5: Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text:
1. Deploy using: 

    mkdocs gh-deploy

  2. This command:

    • Builds the site
    • Pushes it to the gh-pages branch on your GitHub repo

Note

Make sure your GitHub repo has gh-pages enabled in settings.

docs.title: Step 6: Enable GitHub Pages
docs.text:
1. Go to your GitHub repo’s Settings > Pages

  2. Choose Branch: gh-pages / (root) folder

  3. Save the changes

docs.title: Step 7: Access Your Documentation Site
docs.text:
Your GitHub Pages hosted site will be available at: 

https://YOUR_USERNAME.github.io/REPO_NAME/
Example: 
https://charvi-rajput.github.io/my-docs-site/

docs.title: How to change the Favicon icon in MkDocs
docs.text: Changing the favicon in a documentation site helps with branding and recognition. This guide will help you change the Favicon icon in Material for MkDocs and Read the Docs for MkDocs themes available in MkDocs.

docs.title: Prerequisites:
docs.text:
Before proceeding, make sure you have:

  • A documentation project using MkDocs.
  • The Material or Read the Docs theme installed.
  • A .ico or .png file ready to use as your favicon.
    • Named simply, like favicon.ico or favicon.png
    • Ideally in 32x32 pixels

docs.title: Step 1 : Place your Favicon file
docs.text:
Place your favicon file (typically favicon.ico, but .png also works) in the docs/ directory or a subdirectory like docs/img/.

For Example: 

my-project/
├── docs/
│   ├── img/
│   │   └── favicon.ico
│   └── index.md
├── mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Step 2 : Update the mkdocs.yml file
docs.text:
Add the following under the theme: section in your mkdocs.yml: 

theme:
  name: material
  favicon: img/favicon.ico
Make sure the path is relative to the docs/ directory.

Here's the complete example with material theme: 

site_name: How-to-Guides

theme: 
  name: material
  favicon: img/favicon.ico

markdown_extensions: # Some extensions to beautify code, etc
  - codehilite
  - pymdownx.highlight
  - pymdownx.superfences
  - admonition
  - pymdownx.details


nav: # Structure of the page
  - Host MkDocs project using GitHub Pages: index.md
  - Change the Favicon icon in MkDocs: fav.md

docs.title: Step 3 : Preview your Changes
docs.text:
After the changes, run: 

mkdocs serve
Then open your browser at http://127.0.0.1:8000 — the favicon should now appear in the tab. As here, you can see ⓘ icon as the favicon in the browser tab.

docs.title: Step 1 : Place your Favicon file
docs.text:
Place your favicon file (typically favicon.ico, but .png also works) in the docs/ directory or a subdirectory like docs/img/.

For Example: 

my-project/
├── docs/
│   ├── img/
│   │   └── favicon.ico
│   └── index.md
├── mkdocs.yml

docs.title: Step 2 : Do not Update the mkdocs.yml file
docs.text:
MkDocs will automatically detect and use the favicon.ico in the docs/img folder as your favicon icon. 

theme:
  name: material

Here's the complete example with readthedocs theme: 

site_name: How-to-Guides

theme: 
  name: readthedocs

markdown_extensions: # Some extensions to beautify code, etc
  - codehilite
  - pymdownx.highlight
  - pymdownx.superfences
  - admonition
  - pymdownx.details


nav: # Structure of the page
  - Host MkDocs project using GitHub Pages: index.md
  - Change the Favicon icon in MkDocs: fav.md

docs.title: Step 3 : Serve & Test locally
docs.text:
After the changes, run your site locally: 

mkdocs serve
Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 and check your browser tab for the updated favicon. As here, you can see ⓘ icon as the favicon in the browser tab.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Tips
docs.text:
• Cache issues : If the favicon doesn’t update, try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R) or clear browser cache.
  • Use .ico for better cross-browser compatibility.

docs.title: Sample Folder Structure
docs.text:
project-name/
├── docs/
│   ├── index.md
│   ├── img/
│   │   └── favicon.ico
├── mkdocs.yml
